name: DoubleTree by Hilton & Miami Airport Convention Center

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. It must have not been my day. At check in I waited 20 minutes at the Hilton Honors desk to check in. Upon checking into room I noticed that the toilet had "feces" sprayed around the rim and down the front on the toilet. Their was also a large human hair ball in the middle of the tile floor. I ma not making this up. An associate traveling with me stepped into the shower only to find that the handle to turn on the water was missing---no shower that morning.
reviews.title: Horrible experience

reviews.text: The staff did their best to make me feel better as I am a Diamond Member with Hilton. Unfortunatly it did not help much.
reviews.title: Good but far from everything

reviews.text: I spent 3 nights at this hotel. Main reason I chose it was because of the supposed free shuttles to Downtown, airport and shopping malls. The only free shuttle is the one to and from airport. The one to the Dolphin Mall will cost you $10 each time you go there (return) there is no such thing as a shuttle to downtown Miami at all. Hotel breakfast buffet was excellent. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Welcome cookie was great as well. Considering that I am a Gold member of HHonours and I had to insist on the fact that I should have a free upgrade and free breakfast was rather disappointing. I ended up only getting the free breakfast and because I insisted on it not because I was offered. The wifi in the room was so slow that it could frustrate anyone trying rouse the Internet. I ended up buying a prepaid TMobile sim for the IPhone and created my own wifi with my phone and that was faster than the hotel wifi. Go figure!
reviews.title: One night only

reviews.text: Stayed here during an overnight layover. The minimal interaction I had with the staff was pleasant. The room was clean and spacious and well equipped and I appreciated the free airport shuttle so much! The welcome cookie was a nice little treat too.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly and very accommodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here after a delay for flight. Staff was very courteous and made amends for the poor treatment from airlines. The room was spotless and the bed was comfortable. The shower was hot an clean and we were offered hot coffee in the morning when waiting for our cab. This stay was what they all should be like.
reviews.title: Mildew Bathroom
Decent hotel, easy access to highway, but 1 issue
reviews.text: This was a nice doubletree, one of the better ones that I've seen.
Friendly front desk and parking is close by and a good deal.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing is that I found a roach in the bathroom on my 2nd night....not very pleasant.
reviews.title: Not A Great Experience

reviews.text: We needed to go to Taste of Peru last weekend and this hotel was perfect. Walking distance to the fair and to a huge mart where you can find anything you want. It's got a nice fitness center, rooms are quiet and nice, beds, spectacular. Nice view from our room, Cable TV with a lot of good channels, 2 of them in Spanish. Great room service, friendly people and a tasty cookie as a welcome gift, The breakfast buffet is very good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - great for MIA travel

reviews.text: We stayed here last June and it seemed okay. Stayed here again in 11/12 and it wasn't good. Arrived around 1pm and were told that no rooms were available on the executive level that we'd reserved unless we wanted a smoking room. The front desk personnel could have cared less and told us that we needed to wait until a room came available, so we sat in the lobby and waited and waited and waited. She never called us over, but finally I went over for the third time and asked if our room on the executive level was ready. She said it was, so we checked in. Went up to room and it was made up nicely however had a very large stain in the middle of the carpet. Bathtub had a clogg that wouldn't go down. Not to mention that the room was freezing cold. So I called down to the front desk and they told me the hotel didn't have any heat, however they would send up a space heater. Adequate, however very noisy clicking on and off all night long. The front desk also did not inform us that the executive lounge was closed on the weekends. Nor did they let us know that they didn't honor the 'park and fly' feature. We still had to pay $28 in a lot nearby for three nights parking. Nor did they tell us that a breakfast came with our room. Upon checkout I noticed a certificate for 2 in the check-in packet. Nobody at the front desk seemed to care. We will definitely go back to the Marriott chain for reliable service and the 'park and fly' feature offered to those who leave out of MIA. Upon our return at the MIA airport, shuttle was nowhere to be found. Waited almost 45 minutes and called twice.....never again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel & great location

reviews.text: Staying here tonight due to an unexpected layover, this is certainly not a hotel I would choose to stay at again. The lobby appears to be very nicely remodeled, but there is a horrid odor throughout the entire building, including my room. I guess I would call it a mildew smell, but it's overpowering and obnoxious. Other than the awful smell, the rooms are very dated but clean. Hoping for at least a decent nights sleep.
reviews.title: What's the smell???

reviews.text: The hotel front desk and restaurant staff were wonderful,my only complaint was the shuttle driver. One trip he made people wait at the airport for the next shuttle saying it was full.....there were 4 available seats still. On the trip back to the airport (we were traveling as 2 couples) we loaded the shuttle leaving seats for our husbands only for the bus driver to close the doors and try to drive off telling them it was full and they'd have to wait. Again there were still open seats so it was a lie.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but shuttle drivers can be rude

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during October 2012 awaiting the moving van. We chose it because the hotels on Miami Beach were exorbitantly priced, and this hotel was dog friendly. Finding the property entrance is off-putting, the address provided (72nd Avenue) is not where the hotel entrance actually is (7th Avenue) requiring you to pay for convention/self-parking before getting to the hotel entrance, where valet is available at $7 more a day (worth it, unlimited in/ out). Not a problem the second time you need to go there. The biggest problem was our first (yup, we had to move) room, which suffered from an obnoxious odor (mildew wet rag) coming, we decided, from the AC unit. One of the most disgusting smells around, for sure. We moved the second night, after talking to an assistant manager, who thanked us for the feedback and promised to move our bags, but didn't follow through. First night, light dinner through room service was adequate; second night in the hotel restaurant was forgettable. Breakfast available to HiltonHonors members for free was quite good, with a very good selection of hot and cold foods. Second night room was large and smelled much better. Noticed throughout both rooms that items were broken or had become unattached from beds and walls and not repaired; hotel needs much better quality control by housekeeping. Empty beer bottle found on balcony also. Give me a break. Hotel staff generally polite and accommodating.
reviews.title: A nice property - but in decline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you late night staff!!!! I have worked at a hampton for 8 years now and customer service is our #1st,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9,10th priority!! lol My husband and I showed up around 11 pm and the ladies at the desk made us feel so welcomed and without questions our requests were gladly taken care of!! Kudos to this service which makes me proud to work for this brand!! I will certainly stay here whenever we are traveling to this area and will make sure my guests do as well!! Very clean, GREAT breakfast and SERVICE in dining!! Our new favorite place in miami!!! GREAT JOB!!! ....and THANK YOU!!!!
reviews.title: We loved it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Double Tree by Hilton at the Miami airport was a great experience. We stayed at this hotel on a recent vacation to Miami. On check in our room was upgraded to deluxe suite, and the staff was very friendly. As our wedding anniversary was in a few days the hotel gave us breakfast vouchers for our entire stay, and snack vouchers for use at the bar which also included one drink. A request for more hot cookies was also met with a smiling face and given with out issue. Each night on return from touring Miami the staff would was very interested in talking with us. We couldn't of been more satisfied from the room upgrade, the free breakfast, and the wonderful staff all of which made our stay excellent!
reviews.title: Great Experience, and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Having seen some of the reviews I was somewhat concerned however I have no complaints. I booked via Hotwire and got a good rate..The room was large, had all the necessities and was clean; maybe not modern but certainly not shabby. Free internet access in rooms and restaurants. The shuttle runs on the hour and half hour, free of charge, 24 hours a day. On arrival at the airport, there is not much signage showing you the way to hotel shuttles but once outside you just wait and hail the bus pertaining to your hotel. The hotel is 10 minutes drive away. At check in you are given a warm chocolate chip cookie.oh and the hotel shuttle has a large cookie painted on it..so if you see th at you'll know its the Double Tree Bus. You can print out your boarding pass and see flight arrivals/departures on a board in the lobby. The hotel also has several large shops just off the lobby. A full service restaurant, lobby bar serving tapas and a coffee shop for lunch and dinner. Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good- Close to the airport. We were able to leave our car there for only $42 for a week and take their shuttle to the airport for free even though we didn't stay there the night before we left. When we got back there driver was at the airport already so we didn't have to wait at all. Rooms were fairly large. The bad- room wasn't very nice. Every employee other that the shuttle driver was completely useless. The front desk was rude and could hardly speak English. They didn't help us with our bags even though plenty of employees saw us struggling with them. The service in the restaurant was horrible. Rude waitress kept ignoring us. She was walking directly towards me and looking at me and I said excuse me and she walked right on by several times. I would have to say that if you can get the room cheap enough and need to only spend one or 2 nights because you are traveling that it might be worth it. We will look somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: Not that great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for thanksgiving, we had another great stay (we stayed here last year at the same time). We were once again upgraded to a Junior Suite due to our Hilton HHonors status. The room was large and the bed was comfortable. We both enjoyed our free drink along with some very good apitizers at the bar. The cookies were also as usual warm and yummy. The most important thing is that the hotel and the room was clean. The breakfast buffet was also good as usual. I would stay here again. The staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.text: Spent a night to rest w family, after a long flight trip, close to airport so I could go and rent a car the morning after. Conveniently located, with courtesy shuttle. Old styled room, carpet/moquette floor, spacious room. Staff was helpful and friendly. They are close by a (small) market center.
reviews.title: Close to airport, good for a rest or business, old styled

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. I loved the location and the friendliness of the staff. I had an amazing bread pudding that I ordered through room service. My only complaint was that bed head was behind the wall where housekeeping keeps their supplies and every morning there was banging against my headboard. So when you are checking in please ask about the location of your room with regard to proximity of the housekeeping supplies room.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff and lively activity

aka: Doubletree By Hilton & Miami Airport Hotel
description: Newly renovated Lobby, lobby bar, signature restaurant, club loungeMiami's newest convention center over 172,000 sq ft of meeting space
